author: __flcl
content: <@393119312350543872> hi! Is there any way to figure out why this state root https://github.com/ethereum/legacytests/blob/master/Cancun/GeneralStateTests/stExample/eip1559.json#L91  is different from https://github.com/ethereum/legacytests/blob/master/Cancun/GeneralStateTests/stExample/eip1559.json#L104

author: dimitry8570
content:
Check the blockchain version of the test it comes with full state printed. If identical, can ask go evm or evmone to trace execution. Eip 158 might be to account touch?
This test is to check how 1559 tx gets rejected. But the test is generated using transition tool which might handle the state weird.

author: __flcl
content: The roots are for blocks without txs. The tx is rejected in both cases

author: __flcl
content: Just something weird with pre-states or so (which are not falling under EIP-158 cut, cos having nonces=0x1 and balances)

author: dimitry8570
content: Is coinbase acount in pre state? If its empty it still calculated as touched in empty blocks

author: __flcl
content: Oh it's different in Blockchain tests https://github.com/ethereum/legacytests/blob/master/Cancun/BlockchainTests/GeneralStateTests/stExample/eip1559.json#L753

author: __flcl
content: Oh man thank you a lot! Passes now

author: dimitry8570
content:
Ok. Thats a common issue. Shall mark it that t8n calculates an empty block if transaction is rejected and stores its post hash. 

And bc version of the test has invalid block (since tx is rejected) and state remains pre state. 

In legacy tests

author: m0_ox
content:
